Class LRUSim

  • java.lang.Object
    • LRUSim

  • public class LRUSim
extends java.lang.Object
    A simulation system that uses memory management and page replacement to implement virtual memory with demand paging page replacement. This system implements a Least Recently Used replacement algorithm similar to the clock method of implementation.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    rohrj

      • runTillEnd

        public static void runTillEnd()
        Method to be invoked to read through the file until the simulation is done (reached EOF).

      • printStats

        private static void printStats()
        Prints the statistics for all the processes simulation run information. This includes the total pages per process, the number of memory references, the amount of page faults, and the amount of non page faults.

      • printStatus

        private static void printStatus(int id)
        Print the Page Table of the input id, if it's -1, then print all and the Page Frame Table (Physical Memory)
        Parameters:
        id - The Process page table to print

      • initialize

        private static void initialize(java.lang.String fileName)
        Initialize the FileReader and the data arrays for use.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name to read from

      • storeRecords

        private static void storeRecords()
        Update the record information for the overall simulation statistics of a processes total page size and the number of memory references.

      • parseData

        private static void parseData(java.lang.String in)
        Parses the given string into the Process ID and the Page the process is referencing.
        Parameters:
        in - String data to parse

      • lruImplementation

        private static void lruImplementation()
        The Least Recently Used algorithm for page replacement is implemented by having each page frame table entry have a bit set for keeping track of how recently used it is. It is implemented with a pointer to the next spot in physical memory to be checked where if it is empty, place the request there. If the position isn’t and the LRU bit is set to true, then set it to false and move to the next spot; if it is set to false, then clear the victim process’ page accordingly and place the new request in that spot.

      • updatePageFrameTable

        private static void updatePageFrameTable(int pointer)
        Takes the given location pointer to update the physical memory page to the new process and page. It sets victim information for display use and also sets a boolean for the simulation to know when it's had a page fault occur.
        Parameters:
        pointer - The physical memory location to update

      • isDone

        public static boolean isDone()
        Used for telling when the simulation has read all available lines of input.
        Returns:
        true if simulation has read all the lines in the input file, false if not
